alert.note: Alert for Sandia, Manzano Mountains Including Edgewood (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 28 at 3:04AM MST until December 29 at 9:00AM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM MST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow. Total accumulations of 1 to 3 inches below 7,500 feet and 3 to 6 inches above 7500 feet. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. Snow will mix with rain at times today then change to all snow this evening. * WHERE...Sandia and Manzano Mountains including Edgewood. * WHEN...Until 9 AM MST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Tire traction will be reduced. Extend the distance between your vehicle and the vehicle in front of you. This includes along portions of I-40. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The more significant travel impacts are likely tonight and Thursday morning.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. For the latest road conditions, dial 511 or 1.800.432.4269, or visit http://nmroads.com.
